meanings.definition: The remnants of a liquid left in a container, consisting of sediment or grounds.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his coffee, only the dregs remained at the bottom of the cup.
meanings.sent2: She poured out the dregs of the tea before making a fresh cup.
meanings.sent3: The dregs in the cup looked like a tiny mountain of coffee residue.
meanings.sent4: As the party ended, only the dregs of punch were left in the bowl.
meanings.sent5: The dregs of the soup were so thick, they almost seemed like a paste.

meanings.definition: The most worthless part or parts of something.
meanings.sent1: He felt like he was at the dregs of society, surrounded by people who didn't care.
meanings.sent2: The dregs of the project were the only parts that needed to be redone.
meanings.sent3: In the dregs of the old box, she found a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The dregs of the conversation were filled with awkward silences.
meanings.sent5: She sifted through the dregs of the pile, looking for any salvageable items.
